qas.question: What resource has been discovered offshore in recent years?
With what two countries did Cyprus first demarcate its maritime border?

answers.text: Egypt in 2003, and with Lebanon in 2007

qas.question: Which country did Cyprus demarcate its maritime border in 2010?
What is the name of the US-based firm in a production-sharing agreement with Cyprus?

context: In recent years significant quantities of offshore <a0_0>natural gas<a0_0/> have been discovered in the area known as Aphrodite in Cyprus' exclusive economic zone (EEZ), about 175 kilometres (109 miles) south of Limassol at 33°5′40″N and 32°59′0″E. However, Turkey's offshore drilling companies have accessed both natural gas and oil resources since 2013. Cyprus demarcated its maritime border with <a1_0>Egypt in 2003, and with Lebanon in 2007<a1_0/>. Cyprus and <a2_0>Israel<a2_0/> demarcated their maritime border in 2010, and in August 2011, the US-based firm <a3_0>Noble Energy<a3_0/> entered into a production-sharing agreement with the Cypriot government regarding the block's commercial development.
